intro: Crypteronia elegans, commonly known as the white-flowered crypteronia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Crypteronia elegans is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
